page.title: 05BOARDING SCHOOL LIFE 1985
page.content: Unlike most people's opinions of boarding schools, they are not like prison camps, nor, on the other hand, are they like Mallory Towers. Whilst having the advantage of the expansive grounds, one has to live by strict routine. Forced out of bed by a bell at 7:15,there follows a mad rush to the dining_rooms for 8:00,assembly at 9:00 and then lessons until 4:10, with a break for lunch. By lunch_time most people are ready to eat anything and rush over to the dining_rooms after having made a detour to see whether any letters await them. Prep is done from 4:30 _ 6:15 and again after supper, and then there is free time.We go to bed according to age but do not go to sleep at once. It provides an interesting life,but to understand it,one has to be a resident.
